page.title: 14Farming at Atherfield
page.content: Atherfield Green Farm is just under 100 acres.It was bought by the grand- father of the present owner in 1915. When the owner's father farmed the land as a young man he used heavy horses.Tractors didn't come along until 1935.At this time the farm produced vegetables,cereals and grass. It also had a herd of Shorthorn cows which were milked by hand.The farm employed 10-15 men but with the advent of machinery this was cut to 2.Now they no longer milk cows,they rear barley fed bulls for beef,grow all the corn they eat and some potatoes.They also make silage and a small amount of hay for the horses they keep for riding.The farm is almost self- sufficient buying only protein for the cattle,fuel for the tractor and fertilizer for the land.
